page.title: 11HOME LIFE:STANLEYS FARM
page.content: A very helpful couple live at Stanleys Farm,Thurlaston.Their children,a boy,13, goes to Lawrence Sheriff School and a girl,11,attends Tower Lodge.The children's interests include trains,meteorology, animals,playing the violin,table tennis,gymnastics and boardgames.They have a large garden to play in.Their parents avoid them watching too much T.V. Their house has 26 rooms, is heated by oil,and has enough land to produce milk and vegetables. They keep 6 bullocks,30 hens,6 ducks and 2 cats as well as goats.They have lived in the village for 13 years and know much about local history.They were living near by when Droycote reservoir was built and gradually saw the land eroded away.
